activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Nerling

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:35 p.m. Defendant Matthew R Nerling appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Matthew R Nerling.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  COVERS 22CF200 & 22CF205.

22CF205 - Attorney Sutton relates on waiver of Preliminary Hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given, finds probable cause, and binds over for trial.

22CF200 - 1:37 p.m. Patrol Officer Mindi Westberg of the Cumberland Police Department called and sworn.  Direct by State.  Exhibit 1 - Copy of driving record  - Offered by State.  Attorney Sutton cross examines witness on Exhibit 1.  Redirect by State.  State again offers Exhibit 1.  Attorney Sutton objects.   Court receives.  Redirect by State.  1:43 p.m. Cross by Attorney Sutton. 1:44 p.m. questioned by Court.  State moves for bind-over.  Court relates, finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignments set before Judge Babler on 01/04/2023  at 10:00 a.m.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL
Arraignment scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.
AMENDED. Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed to 22CF233 & 22CF240 also.  $25.00 per month starts 11/25/2022.

22CF200 & 22CF205 - Set for prelim before Judge Bitney on 10/19/2022 at 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM. 
22CF233 - Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton with the same terms as her appointment in the underlying files (22CF205/200). Set for prelim before Judge Babler on 10/19/2022 at 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM. 
22CF240 - Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton with the same terms as her appointment in the underlying files (22CF205/200). Set for prelim before Judge Babler on 10/19/2022 at 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM.

1:13 Parties in a break out room. 1:15 Parties return and court sets bond. Must appear in person at the next hearings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:03 AM Defendant Matthew R Nerling not in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Matthew R Nerling.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF200, 22CF205 & 22CF233
Attorney Sutton relates to Defendant's non appearance. 
Court resets.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew R Nerling not in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Matthew R Nerling. 
THIS COVERS 22CF200 & 22CF205 

Cases reset to track along with the Judge Babler file 10/12/22 at 10 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed. Repay $25.00 per month starting 11/25/2022.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:23 AM Defendant Matthew R Nerling in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Matthew R Nerling.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVES CASES 22CF200 AND 22CF205

11:23  Court relates and gives appearances.
11:23  Atty. Firkus relates; he has a conflict and will be withdrawing.  Court appoints Attorney Laura Sutton.  
11:24  Court adjourns both above before Judge Bitney.
Bonds to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
$25.00/month to begin 11/25/2022 for repayment of Attorney Dan Firkus.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages anyplace, anywhere or anytime including their own home.
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises. 
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or permit.

1:18 PM Defendant Matthew R Nerling appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Matthew R Nerling for today only.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. AIA set to next week and MUST APPEAR IN PERSON. Address confirmed and phone number provided/updated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
